page.title: 07A HOUSE IN FORE ST. TOPSHAM
page.content: My grandparents' house is very old. It used to be a market and then a police station. The house belongs to the Market Trust and my grandparents rent it. My family have lived there since my great grandmother's time - I lived there when I was a baby. The house is painted light green and has a very big door. There are two windows downstairs and three upstairs, but one of these has been blocked up. It has got two cells which the prisoners used to be put in and there is a stone bed with a stone pillow inside. The cells have a large heavy wooden door with a little peep hole where they used to put the prisoners' food through.
